data.title: Stars of the Canadian cult comedy Fubar to perform show in Nelson
data.meta_description: Dave Lawrence, the writer and producer of the Fubar movies, and the actor who plays Terry Cahill, is coming to Nelson to perform a live improv show at the Bloom Nightclub in Nelson on April 4. Lawrence will be joined by Terra Hazelton who plays Trish in Fubar 2 and North Darling who plays Shank
data.meta_site_name: Frequency News - Frequency is an audio news platform featuring content produced by journalists based at various campus, community and Indigenous radio stations that broadcast their civic and community journalism to underserved communities across Canada.
data.text:
Dave Lawrence, the writer and producer of the Fubar movies, and the actor who plays Terry Cahill, is coming to Nelson to perform a live improv show at the Bloom Nightclub in Nelson on April 4.

Lawrence will be joined by Terra Hazelton who plays Trish in Fubar 2 and North Darling who plays Shank in the TV show Fubar Age of Computer. The live show will be a look into the lives of Terry and Trish who were married in Fubar 2.

Fubar, released in 2002 and Fubar 2, released in 2010, follow the lives of two “headbangers” from Calgary, AB, Terry Cahill and Dean Murdoch. The movies have a cult following and Fubar was ranked as one of the best Canadian comedies ever made by The Globe and Mail.

For more information, visit the Fubar movie website.

Dave Lawrence joined CJLY for a conversation in character as Terry Cahill.
